CytoDefiningCriteria: Based on sagittal sections of Golgi material
Cajal reported that this cell group contains small multipolar neurons
as well as a dense plexus of collaterals
some of which are derived from the fornix
Nucleus of the stria medullaris.EditorialNote: According to Risold and Swanson (1995), this nucleus was likely first described by Cajal in newborn mice, but has been described by other authors as well.
Nucleus of the stria medullaris.Definition: Small nucleus in the thalamus lying between the fornix and the stria medullaris.
